Nearby Stops

@nycopportunity/standard/src/components/nearby-stops

Demonstration

Stops near
2 MetroTech Center, Brooklyn, NY 11201

  • A C E B D F M G L J Z N Q R W 1 2 3 4 5 6 6 Express 7 7 Express S
Code
<div>
  <p>Stops near
    <br />
    <b>2 MetroTech Center, Brooklyn, NY 11201</b>
  </p>
  <ul class="c-nearby-stops" data-js="nearby-stops" data-nearby-stops-amount="3" data-nearby-stops-endpoint="data/kk4q-3rt2.json" data-nearby-stops-location="[40.693364, -73.9857147]">
    <li class="c-nearby-stops__stop">
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-eighth-avenue">A</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-eighth-avenue">C</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-eighth-avenue">E</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-sixth-avenue">B</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-sixth-avenue">D</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-sixth-avenue">F</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-sixth-avenue">M</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-crosstown">G</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-canarsie">L</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-nassau">J</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-nassau">Z</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-broadway">N</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-broadway">Q</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-broadway">R</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-broadway">W</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-broadway-seventh-avenue">1</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-broadway-seventh-avenue">2</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-broadway-seventh-avenue">3</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-lexington-avenue">4</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-lexington-avenue">5</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-lexington-avenue">6</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway-express border-lexington-avenue">6<span class='sr-only'> Express</span>
      </span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-flushing">7</span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway-express border-flushing">7<span class='sr-only'> Express</span>
      </span>
      <span class="c-nearby-stops__subway bg-shuttles">S</span>
    </li>
  </ul>
</div>

Nearby Stops will parse a list of MTA subway transit data from the NYC Open Data Portal and use a single latitude and longitude to locate the nearest stop. It will not fetch the data directly but will retrieve it from a local endpoint.

Usage

Global Script

Nearby Stops requires JavaScript for fetching data and rendering subway stop templates. To initialize the Nearby Stops instance from the global script use the following code: 

<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/nycopportunity/standard@v0.0.21/dist/js/default.js"></script>

<script>
  var Standard = new Default();

  Standard.nearbyStops();
</script>
Module

For module imports, import the Nearby Stops module from the source.

import NearbyStops from '@nycopportunity/standard/src/components/nearby-stops/nearby-stops';

new NearbyStops();

The class will select any DOM element with the data-js="nearby-stops" attribute and look up the closest stops to the location embedded in the data-nearby-stops-location attribute. The location attribute accepts an array of latitude and longitude.

Use the data-nearby-stops-endpoint attribute to set the endpoint for the Subway stops data. The amount of stops defaults to 3 but can be overwritten using the data-nearby-stops-amount attribute, which accepts a number of stops to display.

Next, "Popover"
